title: House of Representatives - How to read Preference Flows
text: unfamiliar Australian electoral system preferential voting, please look (explainer)[https://www.aec.gov.au/learn/preferential-voting.htm#:~:text=Australian%20federal%20elections%20use%20a,%20white%20ballot%20paper%20(Senate)] proceeding.

title: House of Representatives - How to read Preference Flows
text: get_house_preferences() - provides interface access preference flows particular division (electorate) given year, published AEC’s website . instance: Results can also retrieved disaggregated polling place: also possible filter Polling Place Name (PPNm source): Build top basic function, preference_flow_data() - provides interface access preference flows particular division (electorate) given year. function returns list, element data frame results counting round. basic use: function also include variables, better explained use part next function, house_preference_flow_plot().

title: House of Representatives - How to read Preference Flows
text: Perhaps interesting see round counting assigns votes, candidate chosen. , , packages comes convenience function house_preference_flow_plot(), calls preference_flow_data() plot results alluvial format. Using previous example:  default vote present percentage, can changed changing value var:  analysis, may interesting remove parties initial round - e.g. see votes flow finalists. can done using exclude_parties:   Like plotting functions, possible override colour scheme providing additional named vector:  Similarly, possible get results house_preference_flow_plot() directly, via include_data:
code: house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Wills",year=2019) +   labs(title="Prefence Flow for Wills, 2019") house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Wills",year=2019,var="Preference Count") +   labs(title="Prefence Flow for Wills, 2019") house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Warringah",year=2022) +   labs(title="Prefence Flow for Warringah, 2022") house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Warringah",year=2022, exclude_parties = c("LP","IND-STEGGALL")) +   labs(title="Flow of preference votes to Liberal and Teal in Warringah, 2022") #adding teal house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Warringah",year=2022,                       exclude_parties = c("LP","IND-STEGGALL"),                      extra_colours = c("IND-STEGGALL"="#008080")) +   labs(title="Flow of preference votes to Liberal and Teal in Warringah, 2022") p <- house_preference_flow_plot(division = "Warringah",year=2022,                       exclude_parties = c("LP","IND-STEGGALL"),                      extra_colours = c("IND-STEGGALL"="#008080"),                      include_data=TRUE                      )  p$source_data[[1]] #> # A tibble: 5 × 15 #>    Year StateAb DivisionId DivisionNm CountNum BallotPosition Candidat…¹ Surname GivenNm PartyAb PartyNm Prefe…² Trans…³ Round…⁴ Last  #>   <dbl> <chr>        <int> <chr>         <int>          <int>      <int> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <int> <lgl> #> 1  2022 NSW            151 Warringah         0              6      36808 MICKLE… David … ALP     Austra…    7806       0       1 FALSE #> 2  2022 NSW            151 Warringah         0              4      36675 GLANVI… Kristy… GRN     The Gr…    6910       0       2 FALSE #> 3  2022 NSW            151 Warringah         0              3      36271 ROBERT… Andrew… UAPP    United…    2202       0       3 FALSE #> 4  2022 NSW            151 Warringah         0              1      37516 TRIPP   Steven… ON      Paulin…    1980       0       4 FALSE #> 5  2022 NSW            151 Warringah         0              7      36396 PATERS… Kate A… AJP     Animal…    1475       0       5 TRUE  #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​CandidateId, ²​`Preference Count`, ³​`Transfer Count`, ⁴​RoundPosition

title: House of Representatives - How to read Primary Vote
text: unfamiliar Australian electoral system preferential voting, please look (explainer)[https://www.aec.gov.au/learn/preferential-voting.htm#:~:text=Australian%20federal%20elections%20use%20a,%20white%20ballot%20paper%20(Senate)] proceeding.

title: House of Representatives - How to read Primary Vote
text: get_house_primary_vote() basic function retrieve primarty vote data published AEC. Without arguments, delivery results elections, comes parameters facilitate filtering. instance, get results Brisbane 2022: parameters can include one value, e.g. default, results presented polling place, possible agreggate . also possible restrict results selected polling places Additionally, possible select one states instead group divisions, e.g.: also possible filter results one parties: house_primary_vote_summary() builds basic function summarise data. Using previous filters, possible get ad-hoc summaries, instance - ALP vote Queensland 2022, historic Liberal vote Franklin.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Carlos Yáñez Santibáñez. Author, maintainer. Kyle Walker. Copyright holder. Australian Electoral Commission. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Yáñez Santibáñez C (2022). auspol: Australian Federal Election Results (2004-2022). R package version 0.0.0.9001, https://carlosyanez.github.io/auspol/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {auspol: Australian Federal Election Results (2004-2022)},   author = {Carlos {Yáñez Santibáñez}},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9001},   url = {https://carlosyanez.github.io/auspol/}, }

title: auspol
text: auspol provides result data Australian Federal Elections, 2004 onwards, direclty R. Along functions access data, package also provides functions provide summaries tables plots. data contained release () Apache Parquet format, can used directly programming language/tool/platform supports Parquet.

title: auspol
text: First install required packages,, install package github Alternatively, install r-universe
code: devtools::install_github("carlosyanez/auspol") # Enable this universe options(repos = c(     carlosyanez = 'https://carlosyanez.r-universe.dev',     CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Install some packages install.packages('auspol')

title: auspol
text: find something quite right, please post issue. ideas, want contribute, please let know!

title: auspol
text: package still development. moment, contains data House Representatives.

title: auspol
text: Data sourced directly Australian Electoral Commission. Historical results Commonwealth elections published AEC’s Tally Room archive. functions use code written {tigris} package, maintained Kyle Walker. Icons made  Pixel perfect  www.flaticon.com’ Work progress icons created Freepik - Flaticon

text: division Electoral division year Election year var Variable plotted "Percent" (default) "Preference Count" exclude_parties vector party acronyms exclude plot extra_colours manual mapping colours party, named vector. include_data set TRUE, output primary_vote_summary(), included <<output_var>>$source_data (defaults FALSE)

title: Plot preference flow, for a division for a given year — house_preference_flow_plot

what: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — house_primary_comparison_plot
title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — house_primary_comparison_plot
text: Plot historical changes primary vote electoral division (line chart)

title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — house_primary_comparison_plot
code: house_primary_comparison_plot(   division = NULL,   year = NULL,   state = NULL,   label = "Candidate",   plotted_variable = "Percentage",   sort_by_value = TRUE,   extra_colours = NULL,   plot_format = "lollipop",   include_labels = FALSE,   nudge_x = 5,   parties = NULL,   parties_year = NULL,   include_others = FALSE,   include_informal = FALSE,   individualise_IND = FALSE,   include_data = TRUE,   data = NULL )

title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — house_primary_comparison_plot
text: division Name ONE electoral division year numeric vector election years (2004), defaults . state Code one state label label results, either Candidate Name ("Name",default), Party Name ("PartyNm") Party abbreviation ("PartyAb") plotted_variable Variable plot, "OrdinaryVotes", "Percentage" (default) Percentage_with_Informal sort_by_value Whether sort results descending order (TRUE default) extra_colours manual mapping colours party, named vector. plot_format Whether plot  lollipop chart ("lollipop", default) bar chart. include_labels set TRUE, plot include value. nudge_x labels included, separation chart/dot parties parties include summary. (default), vector strings party acronyms (see list_parties()), number indicating top n parties certain year. parties_year parties NULL number, indicates selection needs certain year (.e.g select historical data three top parties 2012) include_others Boolean used along parties included remaining votes one "" category. include_informal Boolean add informal votes addition party selection. Informal votes included parties selected, top n parties selected, happens top n - even flag set false. individualise_IND set TRUE, party abbreviations independent candidate changed "IND" "IND-<<candidate's surname>>", effectively separating party aggregations. include_data set TRUE, output house_primary_vote_summary(), included <<output_var>>$source_data (defaults FALSE) data Alternative, instead providing parameters, possible provide data frame data plot, following format output  house_primary_vote_summary().

title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — house_primary_comparison_plot
text: ggplot2 object

code: house_primary_historic_plot(   division = NULL,   plotted_variable = "Percentage",   parties = NULL,   parties_year = NULL,   include_others = FALSE,   include_informal = FALSE,   individualise_IND = FALSE,   extra_colours = NULL,   include_labels = FALSE,   year = NULL,   include_data = FALSE,   data = NULL )

title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — house_primary_historic_plot
text: division named vector additional colour (hex) plotted_variable Variable plot, "OrdinaryVotes", "Percentage" (default) Percentage_with_Informal parties parties include summary. (default), vector strings party acronyms (see list_parties()), number indicating top n parties certain year. parties_year parties NULL number, indicates selection needs certain year (.e.g select historical data three top parties 2012) include_others Boolean used along parties included remaining votes one "" category. include_informal Boolean add informal votes addition party selection. Informal votes included parties selected, top n parties selected, happens top n - even flag set false. individualise_IND set TRUE, party abbreviations independent candidate changed "IND" "IND-<<candidate's surname>>", effectively separating party aggregations. extra_colours manual mapping colours party, named vector. include_labels set TRUE, plot include value. year numeric vector election years (2004), defaults . include_data set TRUE, output house_primary_vote_summary(), included <<output_var>>$source_data (defaults FALSE) data Alternative, instead providing parameters, possible provide data frame data plot, folowing format output  house_primary_vote_summary().

title: Plot historical changes in primary vote in a electoral division (line chart) — house_primary_historic_plot
text: ggplot2 object

what: Helper function to download  data — house_primary_vote_summary
title: Helper function to download  data — house_primary_vote_summary
text: Helper function download  data

title: Helper function to download  data — house_primary_vote_summary
code: house_primary_vote_summary(   division = NULL,   state = NULL,   year = NULL,   parties = NULL,   parties_year = NULL,   include_others = FALSE,   include_informal = FALSE,   include_names = TRUE,   individualise_IND = FALSE,   wide_format = NULL )

title: Helper function to download  data — house_primary_vote_summary
text: division vector names electoral divisions (e.g. "Banks", "Wills","Indi") state divisions provide, provide vector state initials e.g. c("NT","TAS") year numeric vector election years (2004), defaults . parties parties include summary. (default), vector strings party acronyms (see list_parties()), number indicating top n parties certain year. parties_year parties NULL number, indicates selection needs certain year (.e.g select historical data three top parties 2012) include_others Boolean used along parties included remaining votes one "" category. include_informal Boolean add informal votes addition party selection. Informal votes included parties selected, top n parties selected, happens top n - even flag set false. include_names whether include candidates name surname extract (TRUE default). individualise_IND set TRUE, party abbreviations independent candidate changed "IND" "IND-<<candidate's surname>>", effectively separating party aggregations. wide_format Whether present result long format, like AEC's source, year--year summary. Options include NULL (summarisation, default), "OrdinaryVotes" (absolute numbers), "Percentage_with_Informal"  "Percentage" (percentage counted elections).

title: Helper function to download  data — house_primary_vote_summary
text: dataframe
